verses.verse: But all the silver and gold, and vessels of bronze and iron, are consecrated to the LORD; they shall come into the treasury of the LORD.”

So the people shouted when the priests blew the trumpets. And it happened when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, and the people shouted with a great shout, that (Heb. 11:30) the wall fell down flat. Then the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.
And they (Deut. 7:2; 20:16, 17) utterly destroyed all that was in the city, both man and woman, young and old, ox and sheep and donkey, with the edge of the sword.

But Joshua had said to the two men who had spied out the country, “Go into the harlot’s house, and from there bring out the woman and all that she has, (Josh. 2:12-19; Heb. 11:31) as you swore to her.”

And the young men who had been spies went in and brought out Rahab, (Josh. 2:13) her father, her mother, her brothers, and all that she had. So they brought out all her relatives and left them outside the camp of Israel.
But they burned the city and all that was in it with fire. Only the silver and gold, and the vessels of bronze and iron, they put into the treasury of the house of the LORD.

And Joshua spared Rahab the harlot, her father’s household, and all that she had. So ((Matt. 1:5)) she dwells in Israel to this day, because she hid the messengers whom Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.

Then Joshua charged them at that time, saying, (1 Kin. 16:34) “Cursed be the man before the LORD who rises up and builds this city Jericho; he shall lay its foundation with his firstborn, and with his youngest he shall set up its gates.”
So the LORD was with Joshua, and his fame spread throughout all the country.

Defeat at Ai But the children of Israel committed a (Josh. 7:20, 21) trespass regarding the (Josh. 6:17-19) accursed things, for (Josh. 22:20) Achan the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of the accursed things; so the anger of the LORD burned against the children of Israel.
Now Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is beside Beth Aven, on the east side of Bethel, and spoke to them, saying, “Go up and spy out the country.” So the men went up and spied out Ai.

And they returned to Joshua and said to him, “Do not let all the people go up, but let about two or three thousand men go up and attack Ai. Do not weary all the people there, for the people of Ai are few.”
So about three thousand men went up there from the people, (Lev. 26:17; Deut. 28:25) but they fled before the men of Ai.

And the men of Ai struck down about thirty-six men, for they chased them from before the gate as far as Shebarim, and struck them down on the descent; therefore (Lev. 26:36; Josh. 2:9, 11) the hearts of the people melted and became like water.
Then Joshua (Gen. 37:29, 34) tore his clothes, and fell to the earth on his face before the ark of the LORD until evening, he and the elders of Israel; and they (1 Sam. 4:12) put dust on their heads.

And Joshua said, “Alas, Lord GOD, (Ex. 17:3; Num. 21:5) why have You brought this people over the Jordan at all—to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to destroy us? Oh, that we had been content, and dwelt on the other side of the Jordan!
O Lord, what shall I say when Israel turns its back before its enemies?

For the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land will hear it, and surround us, and (Deut. 32:26) cut off our name from the earth. Then (Ex. 32:12; Num. 14:13) what will You do for Your great name?”
The Sin of Achan So the LORD said to Joshua: “Get up! Why do you lie thus on your face?

Israel has sinned, and they have also transgressed My covenant which I commanded them. (Josh. 6:17-19) For they have even taken some of the accursed things, and have both stolen and (Acts 5:1, 2) deceived; and they have also put it among their own stuff.

(Judg. 2:14) Therefore the children of Israel could not stand before their enemies, but turned their backs before their enemies, because (Deut. 7:26; (Hag. 2:13, 14)) they have become doomed to destruction. Neither will I be with you anymore, unless you destroy the accursed from among you.

Get up, (Ex. 19:10) sanctify the people, and say, (Josh. 3:5) ‘Sanctify yourselves for tomorrow, because thus says the LORD God of Israel: “There is an accursed thing in your midst, O Israel; you cannot stand before your enemies until you take away the accursed thing from among you.”

In the morning therefore you shall be brought according to your tribes. And it shall be that the tribe which ((Prov. 16:33)) the LORD takes shall come according to families; and the family which the LORD takes shall come by households; and the household which the LORD takes shall come man by man.

(1 Sam. 14:38, 39) Then it shall be that he who is taken with the accursed thing shall be burned with fire, he and all that he has, because he has (Josh. 7:11) transgressed the covenant of the LORD, and because he (Gen. 34:7; Judg. 20:6) has done a disgraceful thing in Israel.’ ”
So Joshua rose early in the morning and brought Israel by their tribes, and the tribe of Judah was taken.
He brought the clan of Judah, and he took the family of the Zarhites; and he brought the family of the Zarhites man by man, and Zabdi was taken.
